utterances: Let's see if we can get - we have one more call that came in on our phone.
And let's see if we can listen to that call now.
It needs a little setup, so Christy(ph) from Laramie, Wyoming, told this joke, and it's about three statisticians that go deer hunting.
The first statistician crouches, aims and fires, but his shot goes off to the right.
The second statistician steps up to take her shot, but it veers off to the left.
Seeing this, the third statistician jumps up and cheers, we got him.
We gave that a huge laugh.
There was one joke on - about statisticians that came on our site that's talked about them being mean, meaning the mean, playing off on the word mean.
A statistician walks into just your average bar.
Bartender says, we don't serve statisticians in this bar.
The statistician says, well, you're just mean.
You gave away the punch line before I told the joke.
But you still told it very well.
Let me see if we can get - don't try this at home.
So it's more of a pickup line.
So if I were a DNA, I'd be a DNA helicase so I could unzip your genes.
The DNA helicase unzips the G-E-N-E-S.
That's genes for the children who can't spell, though.
That's a good one to use on Friday night at the bar.
Have you used that line yet, Ian?
I think that would work very well with anyone with an advanced degree in molecular biology.
I'd like - use that and tell us what happened.
Yeah, even kids are coming up with pickup lines.
Are there any science pickup lines, any jokes you can think of?
That was the one I've ever heard.
Don't forget, we're a public radio show.
Well, I used to whisper sweet nothings into my girlfriend's ear, 10 to the minus eight, 10 to the minus nine.
We did - we had some really obscure ones.
